answers.answer: I am wondering if you blood sugars are dipping, not saying it might be maturity onset diabetes, but I would certainly go to your doctor and ask for a blood sugar test.Mars Bars are a fast boost, or Barley Sugar Sweets, if you can keep some of them with you when you go out incase..Also can you tolerate a high fibre diet?, if you can then it is slower to digest and will keep you going a lot longer and then no great urges to eat inbetween..

question: My issue is this - two to three times a day I experience sudden onset of intense hunger.  I have about a 15 second warning with a hunger pang or two.  If I do not eat something within 3 minutes once the intense hunger starts, the feeling changes to intense nausea (this only happens if I do NOT eat).  If I do not eat within a minute or two of the intense nausea, I will vomit.  If I can eat within the 3 minutes period of time after the intense hunger starts, the feeling will go away in seconds.I have experienced this for approximately 10 years. For the first 9 years or so this happened a couple times a month.  Now it is happening 2-3 times a day.  I literally have to have food with me or near me (something quick, candy, crackers, etc) all the time as the feelings intensify so quickly that I am nearly unable to function.I have the following:  Hiatal hernia, GERD, IBS, Schatzski's ring, and various cardiac issues.  I am 50 years of age.  I was diagnosed with IBS at 20; diagnosed with the hiatal hernia, S. ring and GERD approximately 12 years ago.  I am on an appropriate medical regimen.
title: Intense hunger then nausea
